      • isLateTeamSplit

        public boolean isLateTeamSplit()
        Description copied from interface: jumpingalien.facade.IFacade
        Return a boolean indicating whether the code at stake is the effort of an late team split (split after May 5). In that case, the code must include sharks.
        Specified by:
        isLateTeamSplit in interface jumpingalien.facade.IFacade

      • hasImplementedWorldWindow

        public boolean hasImplementedWorldWindow()
        Description copied from interface: jumpingalien.facade.IFacade
        Return a boolean indicating whether the code at stake has implemented the positioning of the world's window. This is especially meant for students that started in a team, but ended up working individually.
        Specified by:
        hasImplementedWorldWindow in interface jumpingalien.facade.IFacade

      • createMazub

        public Mazub createMazub(int pixelLeftX,
                         int pixelBottomY,
                         jumpingalien.util.Sprite... sprites)
                  throws jumpingalien.util.ModelException
        Description copied from interface: jumpingalien.facade.IFacade
        Create an instance of Mazub with given pixel position and given sprites. The actual position of the new Mazub will correspond with the coordinates of the left-bottom corner of the left-bottom pixel occupied by the new Mazub. The new Mazub will be stationary.
        Specified by:
        createMazub in interface jumpingalien.facade.IFacade
        Throws:
        jumpingalien.util.ModelException

      • getActualPosition

        public double[] getActualPosition(Mazub alien)
                           throws jumpingalien.util.ModelException
        Description copied from interface: jumpingalien.facade.IFacade
        Return the actual position of the given alien. Returns an array of 2 doubles {x, y} that represents the coordinates of the bottom-left corner of the given alien in the world. Coordinates are expressed in meters.
        Specified by:
        getActualPosition in interface jumpingalien.facade.IFacade

        public int getOrientation(Mazub alien)
                   throws jumpingalien.util.ModelException
        Description copied from interface: jumpingalien.facade.IFacade
        Return the orientation of the given alien. The resulting value is negative if the given alien is oriented to the left, 0 if the given alien is oriented to the front and positive if the given alien is oriented to the right.

      • createWorld

        public World createWorld(int tileSize,
                         int nbTilesX,
                         int nbTilesY,
                         int[] targetTileCoordinate,
                         int visibleWindowWidth,
                         int visibleWindowHeight,
                         int... geologicalFeatures)
                  throws jumpingalien.util.ModelException
        Description copied from interface: jumpingalien.facade.IFacade
        Create a new game world with given tile size, given number of tiles in both directions, with given coordinate for the target tile, with given width and height for the visible window, with its tiles filled with the given geological features, and with no game objects yet. The geological features are given in the order from left to right and (then) from bottom to top. Tiles for which no geological feature is given, are filled with AIR.
        Specified by:
        createWorld in interface jumpingalien.facade.IFacade
        Throws:
        jumpingalien.util.ModelException

      • terminateWorld

        public void terminateWorld(World world)
                    throws jumpingalien.util.ModelException
        Description copied from interface: jumpingalien.facade.IFacade
        Terminate the given world.
        Specified by:
        terminateWorld in interface jumpingalien.facade.IFacade

      • getSizeInPixels

        public int[] getSizeInPixels(World world)
                      throws jumpingalien.util.ModelException
        Description copied from interface: jumpingalien.facade.IFacade
        Return the size of the given game world in number of pixels. The resulting array contains the width of the given world in pixels followed by the height of the given world in pixels.
        Specified by:
        getSizeInPixels in interface jumpingalien.facade.IFacade
        Throws:
        jumpingalien.util.ModelException

        public int getTileLength(World world)
                  throws jumpingalien.util.ModelException
        Description copied from interface: jumpingalien.facade.IFacade
        Return the length of the side of a tile in the given world. The length is expressed as a number of pixels.
        Specified by:
        getTileLength in interface jumpingalien.facade.IFacade
        Throws:
        jumpingalien.util.ModelException

      • getGeologicalFeature

        public int getGeologicalFeature(World world,
                                int pixelX,
                                int pixelY)
                         throws jumpingalien.util.ModelException
        Description copied from interface: jumpingalien.facade.IFacade
        Return the geological feature of the tile in the given world at the given pixel position. The function returns 0 for AIR, 1 for SOLID GROUND, 2 for WATER and 3 for MAGMA, 4 for ICE and 5 for GAS. Throws ModelException if there is no tile at the given position. This method must return its result in (nearly) constant time.
        Specified by:
        getGeologicalFeature in interface jumpingalien.facade.IFacade
        Throws:
        jumpingalien.util.ModelException

      • setGeologicalFeature

                                 int pixelX,

                                 int geologicalFeature)
                          throws jumpingalien.util.ModelException
        Description copied from interface: jumpingalien.facade.IFacade
